name: AesopCo
description:
Aesop's Pawnshop is now an interstellar franchise brought to you by the Weyland Consortium! Bring us your mid-cost ice, and watch as it's backdoor-riddled subroutines are broken down into component code, then retooled and deployed in the Amazon Basin by crack sysadmin Akitaro Watanabe! Your servers will glisten in the lunar sun!

Few cards in this deck cost more than $5.

Note how to churn with The Root: After the runner's last action, rez it for $6, and immediately spend 3 tokens. At the start of the turn, spend 3 more tokens then sacrifice it for $6. Rez targets include Amazon Industrial Zone, Private Contracts, and Eve Campaign. Net gain up to $6 for 1 click.

name: Blue Sun Combo
description: Basically, Blue Sun allows you to pull up your biggest ice to kill the runner, so it makes it a prime deck for Scorching. Tollbooth is also amazing, anything that's punishing to face-check is super great early game as well.

name: Infra-Roja
description:
Zone in and attack!

Just switched to Armitages earlier today...seemed to work a bit better than Daily Casts. The key is to be aggressive at the right times, and you can pick up some quality victories with this. :)

This my first Anarch deck, so please, drop me some feedback!

name: Red Snapper II - The Upgrade
description:
After a bit of play testing, I decided I should make a couple of small tweaks to this deck. The decoys are gone, as is Project Ares in favor of 2 Wisps and an NAPD Contract .

If anyone has any further suggestions to improve this deck, please feel free to comment!

name: Hard Stealth Kit
description:
Move fast enough and they'll never see you coming.

This is a hardware-centric Kit build that can get set up scary fast with Replicator and Inside Man. Drawing into your Magnum Opus is perfection, but tutoring for it with an early SMC/Test Run is hardly ever a bad move (you can always clone that SMC back later). In fact I usually dedicate my first SMC to making sure Mopus hits the table; not only does it set up a devastating economic potential, but it's your Scorch/Midseasons protection in a deck that just doesn't have time for Plascrete. That makes it all the more important to realize the healthy mix of blazing speed you can achieve needs to be tempered with economic patience. The more money you have, the less the corp can do to you. There are usually one or two money-making turns you should be able to identify in most games, wherein you should feel comfortable letting off server pressure and clicking Mopus for 8 credits; in much the same way corps identify scoring windows, your win rate with this deck will skyrocket when you can start to identify economy windows.

You can look at dropping the second copy of Magnum Opus if you're dead set on making the 45 card limit, but an early Replicator will easily thin anywhere between 6 and 8 cards from your deck, so this build plays much tighter than you'd think. I'll be adding 2 Astrolabes once Up & Over drops, and I doubt I'll cut anything to do so. This deck can also run a one-off Deus X or Sharpshooter if you want it to, but I personally favor patient play over the silver bullets. Give it a try and let me know how it works for you!

name: code gate city
description: been messing with this for a while, dont know where its going

name: Drugs - not even once...definitely thrice
description:
Effectively getting a rig out is done using stimhacks with SMC / Clone chip.

It's not supposed to be competitive, but it's insanely fun watching people's looks when you slap down a stimhack turn one and get out Garrote or something.

And yeah, I don't own Lunar Cycle, so I can't use cards from it...sadness is real.

name: 501c(3) Conservative Death Extension
description: Iceless trap deck. Plenty of damage and bad publicity. No tags required!

name: Thom's fleet street quartet
Never Advance Hub
description:
Been having some success with this deck at some local games nights. Main idea behind the deck is to combine the work compression that Jinteki PE does so well with the FA goodness coming out of NBN. It tries to create really early game pressure which forces the runner to run aggressively and punishes them if they aren't careful or slow down.

Core concept of the deck is to outpace the runner and rush out 7 agenda points really quickly, but unlike Astrobiotics which tries to speed things up on the Corp side with Biotic Labors, this deck uses Snares, Psychic Fields and Scorched Earth to tries to slow the Runner down. NEH is perfect for some shell game shenanigans because of the extra draw power you get from the ID. I've often found that a successful Psychic Field or Snare landing on the Runner can create the scoring window for an ASPP.

I still think I need to learn how to shell game properly to make this deck work better, but I've been doing pretty well with it so far in testing and games nights. The way I'm piloting it now, I can probably get a win in 80% of the time. Out of those wins, I'd say half are won through scoring 7 points and the other half are won through flatline. One of my favourite plays is to leave a Breaking News unprotected in a remote, wait until the runner hits a Snare or Psychic Field and score off the BN and land a Scorched Earth on my turn.

name: Silhoette Suppling Power
description:
No real tricks just lots of access and cheaper resources/hardware thanks to the supplier.

I have enjoyed using this deck and playing as sil so far the only problem i've found is somethings getting all the breakers crypsis helps but i think i may need another special order for the deck.

i've always liked expose but i find i can't justify the deck slot for it sil fix's this though. I think account could work here but i am so uster not taking tags off with it it can ruin you.

I really like daily casts with the supplier netting 7c and not even setting you back a turn, and kati their are times i have her and have only one click spare so can't use her that turn it seems such a waste to just drop her like that but with supplier i can at least save 2c doing so.

name: Jinteki TrapAdvance #1
description:
Currently 2-0 vs. a criminal runner deck. Needs some work; the ice is a little thin, but the econ seems okay. Might kill Project Junebug in favour of another Shi.Kyu. Not sure about Ronin vs. Plan B, I think one needs to go to make room for the other.

I really want to combo something/Inazuma/Bullfrog to force someone to run against one of my traps... :D

name: SUPER BIG - W
description:
Counter against "just milllllll deck"(does this exist?)

ahh... and nothing else.

name: Sympathetic Junkie  Ver: 0.1
description:
Abuse Stimhack to get your rig of 2 x Femme Fatale, 1 x Torch and 1 x Snowball out. Scavenge Femme Fatale or Snowball to Dinosaurus, when you eventually draw it.

Public Sympathy is there to ease the pain of Stimhacking and helps to keep those multi-access cards in hand.

Untested as of 12.10.2014.

name: Make Friends
description: Pretty simple deck

name: The Santa Maria
The Red Rez Tax
description: Designed to make rezzing ice costly, keep the corp poor with vamps. If they do rez Ice, Darwin and Parasite for the little uns, Knight for the biggies. Or emergency shut down....

name: Watermelon
description: Green on the outside, red in the middle.

name: Rihanna Knows Your Secrets v2
description:
Lay the bad pub asap. Once you do, run remotes for free.

Dropped the Activist Support for 3 MO and the Kati Jones for 3 Early Bird.

name: Darwin and Me
description:
The idea behind this deck was not inspired by a deep analysis of game mechanics, a desire to win epic matches at worlds, or even a love of a specific faction or ID.
Nope - this deck came from the fact that my son's name is Darwin and my name is David.

From there, I started wondering how these two cards would work together and what a deck would need in order to make them work. Some key thoughts are:

  • Darwin at Strength 4 does everything that D4vid can't do (except Swordsman). E3 Feedback Implants is an obvious match for both cards.
  • Darwin can be hurried along with Surge and The Personal Touch.
  • A Mimic and a Corroder are probably a good idea because of Swordsman and Wraparound. Don't want to waste those D4vid counters on wraparounds when they're so ubiquitous in NBN.
  • Medium for R&D dig also gives another target for those Surges. Throw a couple of Legworks in for surprise factor.
  • Cyberfeeders help with econ. Otherwise, rely on Kati/Dirty Laundry/Liberated Accounts.

Originally, I was fitting 2x Fester in this deck but I just don't think it's worth it. Even with both out, more often than not the corp can afford the 4 bucks. Their efficacy seem pretty situational.

As always, feedback is welcome!

name: Oracle Beckman Theory
description: a Thing I'm considering trying - seems like the double-heavy deck might like Rachel Beckman's extra click? Also gives another potential use for Hostage

name: Mandatory Suicide
description:
Prevent the runner from breaking your Bullfrog and throw him into a Cerebral Overwriter with Port Anson Grid.

Inazuma + RSVP should help you win the Psis and even prevent the runner from stealing Fetal AI, but taking the net damage.

In the end, if the combo doesn't show, this deck has a lot of Psi and annoying ice, along with Mushin No Shin mindgames and net damage. Anyway, Jinteki fun.

Of course this could be a Jinteki: Personal Evolution deck, but why not try a different approach?

name: Advancement denial
description: An attempt to combine the source and chakana to make scoring agendas harder. Heavy RnD pressure with Cyber-Cyphers on omni drives from the word go.

name: Psychological Suicide
description: Inspired from Mandatory Suicide made by vvribeiro. Making everything to kill the runner. Keep over advancing Cerebral Overwriter even if the runner don't fall for it, Bullfrog and Port Anson Grid is there to make sure he's going to take it. Cerebral Cast helps you to get the kill in one way or another.

name: Ancestral Synergy
description:
This is my first Quetzal deck that I came up with.

Playtested it and in 5 games it went 4-1 against different corps ( 2x NBN Tag me decks, 1 Foundary rest can't remember )

The idea of it is to run maximum agression since turn 1. Pressure on all central servers ( as needed with all competative decks ). Keyhole for Achives and R&D, Account Siphon for HQ.

There is tons of synergy in this deck:

1) Deep Red with Overmind

2) Overmind with E3

3) Quetzal's ability with E3

4) Knight with E3

5) Datasucker and Parasite

6) Scrubbed and Bishop, to keep the strengt of ICE lower, hence to lower the money needed to pump Overmind with

7) Bishop is instant cast since Deep Red

8) Play Hades shard from hand to eliminate Jessus Jackson

9) D4v1D with E3, to pass Archer for 3c ( and a counter) ;)

You will be destroying a lot of Ice because of Parasite and Knights and your opponent will be reluctant to play barriers and will often trash them.

The deck is not in it's final shape, but it's pretty much there.

Just a few words on the econ, why Katie? Tried playing without Katie, it's playable ... but not competative ... you will often find yourself 3 or 5 credits short of being able to win the game decicevely and the NBN assets can be a pain to trash without Katie ( or Imp or Scrubber).

enjoy ;)

name: Balanced Blue Sun
description:
Blue sun Deck with a range of funnies. This deck is a balanced Blue Sun with some answers for many common problems. Most of the ice is taxing with a decent glacier plan. I was running into AI breaker problems and decided to include a single swordsman. I think one off program destruction ice are pretty valuable in the sentry slots for Blue Sun. You can bounce them once rezzed and keep the runner guessing where you reinstall, it's a low risk high reward gamble for you. I've liked having Crisium around as an upgrade against most decks, its not a combo card here. Having Ash/Willo/crisium becomes an additional guessing game for the runner and works in the decks favor even when the runner knows all of the cards in it. I was running more 0/1 str ice in the deck but they keep getting blown up as the only targets for parasite. My two cash outlets are Ash and PC, I haven't tested the deck enough to know whether both should be included or not. 

 I was running archer with hostile takeover but never found myself actually wanting to rez it, I am now trying another suite of agendas can't tell if its better or not, more testing feels necessary. I have yet to test NAPD even though I can see it being superior to Goethermal, as of yet the extra money is making me feel secure.

name: Quetzal
description: a Quetzal I've been working with a lot, it feels comfy.

name: Pandora's BOX-E v0.3
description:
Pandora's BOX-E is a deck that utilizes the following card combinations to maximize draws, high impact runs, and re-usability of select programs: BOX-E, Public Sympathy, Professional Contacts, Overmind, and standard Shaper tools. Set up BOX-E or Overmind early on using Modded, use professional contacts for great click efficiency to get the cards you need from your deck, and load up Kati Jones for big hail mary runs. 1 of run events are used with Same Old Things to make large impact runs. D4v1d and Sneakdoor are both tools to surprise the corp with later on: d4v1d to abuse high strength Ice with e3 implants, and Sneakdoor to get in to HQ once it's fully Iced.

In my opinion the all stars of this deck are Dirty Laundry and Modded. These two click efficient cards allow the shaper to keep up with extremely fast deck archetypes such as NEH-FA, and are open enough to use during any point in the game.

Potential changes: I'm finding I don't get professional contacts early enough with only 2, and I want to test out HQ Interface since I have added Sneakdoor Beta.

name: Weyland Genesis
HB Genesis
Criminal / Genesis
Shaper Genesis
